meanings.definition: To remove a rope or ropes from something.
meanings.sent1: I will unrope the boat from the dock.
meanings.sent2: Please unrope the package carefully to avoid damaging it.
meanings.sent3: As the magician performed his trick, he managed to unrope himself from the tight knots.
meanings.sent4: Her words had the power to unrope the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: With a swift motion, he unroped the horse and set it free.

meanings.definition: To become untied or unfastened from a rope.
meanings.sent1: The knot started to unrope itself slowly.
meanings.sent2: The boat suddenly unroped from the pier and drifted away.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to unrope the bird feeder and steal the seeds.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to unrope all the worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The wind's force was strong enough to unrope the flag from its pole.

meanings.definition: To release or free from being tied up with a rope.
meanings.sent1: The hero rushed to unrope the captured princess from the villain's clutches.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter worked quickly to unrope the trapped kitten from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The clever escape artist always found a way to unrope himself from any situation.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like a gentle hand that unroped the sadness from his heart.
meanings.sent5: The key to freedom was hidden in the ability to unrope oneself from fear.
